question_sentence: Tom Brady announced he was unretiring after someone spent how much on the football with which Brady threw his "final" career touchdown pass?
In a statement from Starbucks, the company said it is ‘shifting away’ from:
Which musician asked to be removed from Rock & Roll Hall of Fame consideration, only for the organization to deny their request?
On Wednesday, President Biden announced how much in additional aid will be sent to Ukraine?
Brooklyn Nets guard Kyrie Irving erupted for 60 points on Tuesday, one night after which star scored the same amount?
The Senate passed the Sunshine Protection Act, which, if signed into law, would do what?
choices: Set clocks back two hours instead of one

question_sentence: On Twitter, Elon Musk challenged Russia's President Vladimir Putin to what kind of competition?
An assistant principal in Mississippi was fired for reading which children's book to second graders?
A little girl who was found dead in the desert 61 years ago was recently identified as Sharon Lee Gallegos. Up until now, she was known as:
A shaving method for women taking TikTok by storm is said to give you an instantaneous youthful glow. What's it called?
The wreck of Antarctic explorer Ernest Shackleton’s ship the Endurance was discovered well preserved in which sea over a century after it was abandoned?
evidence: The explorer set out to cross Antarctica via the South Pole on the 1914 Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition. But he was forced to abandon the Endurance after it was crushed between ice floes in January 1915.

question_sentence: Which Latin alphabet letter has become a symbol of support for Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine?
evidence: The Z symbol, which does not exist in the Cyrillic Russian alphabet, was first spotted on military vehicles. Some interpret the letter as short for the Russian word for ‘victory’, while others say it represents the language’s word for ‘west

question_sentence: Nicola Sturgeon offered a formal apology to people accused of what crime between the 16th and 18th centuries?
evidence: It is thought that some 4,000 Scots, mostly women, were executed after being accused of breaking the Witchcraft Act between 1563 and 1736

question_sentence: Labour confirmed that it will not be using which controversial process for selecting candidates for the next general election?
evidence: The party was advised that all-women shortlists would be ‘unlawful’ because the majority (52%) of its MPs are female

question_sentence: What was Olena Zelenska’s job before she became Ukraine’s first lady?
evidence: Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s wife worked on scripts at her husband's television production company Kvartal 95.

question_sentence: How many McDonald’s restaurants operated in Russia before the chain pulled out this week following the invasion of Ukraine?
evidence: The first of the fast food chain’s 850 stories opened in 1990 on Moscow’s Pushkin Square.

question_sentence: A US study has found that exposure to which substance may have lowered the IQ of about half the country’s population?
evidence: For people born in the 1960s and the 1970s, when leaded gas use was increasing, the IQ loss was found to be up to seven points

question_sentence: Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who died this week, was often referred to as a ‘larrikin’ by his countrymen. What does the colloquial term mean?
evidence: Widely considered one of the best bowlers in cricketing history, he took 708 Test wickets throughout his 14-year career, more than any other bowler in history

question_sentence: What was the name of the political theorist and women’s rights activist who organised the first International Women’s Day?
evidence: The activist came up with the idea of an international day for women at the International Conference of Working Women in Copenhagen in 1910, where it was unanimously agreed upon

question_sentence: When did Roman Abramovich buy Chelsea FC?
evidence: The Russian oligarch has been sanctioned by the government as part of its response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, which means he is currently unable to sell the club as he had planned

question_sentence: What new item is NASA trying to send to the moon?
evidence: NASA is currently collecting a list of names to be put on a flash drive that will be sent to the moon on the Orion spacecraft launch later this year. Learn how to send your name to space!

question_sentence: How many refugees have fled Ukraine since the Russian invasion plunged the country into war?
evidence: More than 3 million Ukrainians have fled their country since Russia launched its invasion, according to the latest data from the UN. Poland is by far the biggest recipient of refugees from Ukraine, accounting for more than 1.7 million people.

question_sentence: Pfizer announced people will need a fourth dose of Covid-19 vaccine to help fend off another wave of the pandemic. Why did the company’s CEO say a fourth dose is necessary?
evidence: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla said a fourth dose is needed for all of the reasons above. Protection after three doses is “not that good against infections” and “doesn’t last very long” when faced with a variant like Omicron, Bourla said, emphasizing an increase of breakthrough cases are expected.

question_sentence: Sixty-five companies, including tech giants Apple and Google, called on the governor of which state to abandon anti-LGBTQ+ legislation?
evidence: The companies signed an open letter calling on the governor of Texas to abandon anti-LGBTQ+ initiatives. The letter also included a scathing critique of Gov. Greg Abbott’s order to investigate gender-affirming surgical procedures and treatments in young people.

question_sentence: The US recently reached the highest recorded average for a gallon of gas. What is it?
evidence: The average price for a gallon of gas reached $4.33, which is higher than it was in 2008 when it was $4.11. And unfortunately, experts say gas prices will likely remain historically high for at least the next few weeks.

question_sentence: Which social media platform has banned users in Russia?
evidence: Instagram users in Russia were banned from accessing the social media platform Monday due to Putin’s ongoing attack in Ukraine. The decision was met by outrage in Russia, where authorities have opened a criminal investigation against Meta, Instagram’s parent company.

question_sentence: Which star athlete announced he will be returning to his sport just weeks after retiring?
evidence: Brady is back. The legendary quarterback said he is on the hunt for another Super Bowl ring after spending 40 days in retirement.

question_sentence: Which film won the award for best picture at The 27th Annual Critics Choice Awards this week?
evidence: “The Power of the Dog” walked away with the award for best picture. The Netflix drama earned four awards total, including best director.

question_sentence: A former US president tested positive for Covid-19 this week. Who was it?
evidence: Former President Barack Obama announced that he tested positive for Covid-19. Obama said that his wife, former first lady Michelle Obama, tested negative. Both Obamas are vaccinated and boosted, the former President said in a statement.

question_sentence: The Senate recently passed a bill that would make what practice permanent across the US?
evidence: The Senate passed a measure that would make Daylight Saving Time permanent across the United States. If the measure clears Congress and is signed into law, it would mean no more falling back every year in the fall.
